items.preText:
Two fresh batsmen on the pitch who haven't faced a ball yet

Nick: "Yeah, Ferguson has been the breakout bowler this summer imo, starting with his performance in the UAE. He's a lock for the World Cup XI in my eyes." And Bangladesh have lost four before he's come to bowl
items.text: targets the off stump from wide of the crease, on length, Mahmudullah gets an inside edge to fine leg. He's off the mark
takes it away from his first ball, that teasing line outside off, he goes for the drive and misses it completely
items.shortText: Henry to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: pushes this one into the covers again, but it nips in a bit and takes an inside edge to the leg side
uses soft hands to guide that length delivery towards third man
starts with a leg-stump line on the pads, doesn't bounce much and he helps it to leg
bangs it in, another bouncer from Boult, and he ducks under it

items.preText: Jonathan : "when a bowler who bowls 150kph and is healthy you gotta pick him cause even on a bad day they'll still pick up wickets with that pace "
items.text: pushes that full delivery down the ground towards mid-off and takes off for the single immediately to make it in time
tempting line outside off to have a go, 141kmh, good angle too but he lets it go
items.shortText: Boult to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: stifled appeal for lbw as he swings this one in, Mithun is falling over while trying to clip it. It pitched on leg, maybe just outside, and was going down further to not move S Ravi again
items.shortText: Boult to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: tries a similar delivery but it's too full this time, a low full toss, and Mithun gets enough bat to clip it fine for four. Bangladesh need those runs
items.shortText: Boult to Mohammad Mithun, FOUR runs

items.text: just outside off and he defends it away towards point

items.preText: KP: "Matt Henry is the right bowler to partner Boult at the top, the current selection of 3 fast bowlers is the right one for NZ heading into the World Cup."
items.text: uses soft hands this time for the length delivery outside off, gets a thick edge to third man

items.preText: Wow..ball-tracking for 9.5 shows that pitched in line and was 'hitting' leg stump
items.text: outside off again, he watches carefully and defends
items.shortText: Henry to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: little too wide this time and het lets it go
items.shortText: Henry to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: back towards the stumps from length, no room at all, and he defends it back
items.shortText: Henry to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: back of length around off stump, he stays back and defends it towards point
items.postText: Cam: "Boult has to be up there with the absolute best quicks in the world right now - he's been lethal with the white ball recently. Great to see Henry in the wickets too - it's almost criminal that he's been stuck behind other guys for so long."
items.shortText: Henry to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: too wide outside off, he reaches out for it away from his body and drives it square. Point gets a hand to it with a dive and they take two
better line closer to off stump, almost makes Mahmudullah play that one. He pokes and misses
a bouncer this time on the leg side, he ducks under it easily
too wide again outside off, Boult losing his line a bit, and it's left alone again

the short ball has done it, looks like an edge because of the sound but Mahmudullah has reviewed straightaway. Boult banged it in short, it opened the batsman up who held his bat in front of the shoulders. Snicko and replays show there was nothing off the bat, it was the right shoulder instead. DRS to the rescue
beats the outside edge again with that teasing line, away movement and accuracy. He pokes and misses

items.preText: First change - here's Colin de Grandhomme
items.text: shapes it away nicely but well outside off, left alone
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: nipping it in this time towards off stump, he pushes it back
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: some away swing again well outside off, Mithun throws his hands at it but finds mid-off
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Mohammad Mithun, no run
